title: [$500] Chat - Emoji Picker Doesn't Close on User B's Side When User A Deletes a Message

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @adelekennedy (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @getusha (`External`)

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
Chat - Emoji Picker Doesn't Close on User B's Side When User A Deletes a Message
### What is the root cause of that problem?
In the function where the delete message is handled, we are not checking if emoji picker is active.
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/b30b55574bd3453c7c8d012aa39d62fe9de569f6/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionItemFragment.js#L108-L110
### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
We should add this 
`if (EmojiPickerAction.isActive(props.action.reportActionID)) {
                EmojiPickerAction.hideEmojiPicker(true);
}`
in the if condition below so that it gets hidden whenever deletion is intercepted
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/b30b55574bd3453c7c8d012aa39d62fe9de569f6/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionItemFragment.js#L108-L110
### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)

@DylanDylann @saikoaizen  your RCA is not correct & complete, we already have a logic to handle cases when a message is deleted https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/b30b55574bd3453c7c8d012aa39d62fe9de569f6/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionItem.js#L184

@dukenv0307 i see the only difference in your proposal from @s-alves10's is prevIsDeletedParentAction can you explain why we need to check if they are equal and return early?

@getusha Here is the first proposal from @s-alves10 It will make the clean-up function call and all menus are hidden when any dependency is changed and it's edited after. I use `prevIsDeletedParentAction` to prevent the unnecessary check when the component is rendered the first time.

@dukenv0307 

`reportActionID` would never change during the lifecycle of the `ReportActionItem` component.
And `reactionListRef` won't change once it's created

So the above effect callback will be called only when `isDeletedParentAction` changes
I just wrote the idea and make it clear later.

And as @getusha mentioned, `prevIsDeletedParentAction` isn't needed at all
The clean-up function will be called when a state is changed. So with the first proposal, context menu is also hidden that isn't expected. And your proposal is edited after I posted my proposal.

I didn't write the cleanup callback clearly because it isn't so important

That's a minor problem and can be handled while reviewing
You specify that you will update the existed useEffect which contains the clean-up function when the first time you proposed and this will cause the regression.

@dukenv0307 

AFAIK, adding minor optimization or fix doesn't have big impact on selecting a proposal as long as its RCA is correct and suggested solution can fix the issue. Possible regressions will be handled during the PR review. 

I don't want to argue anymore. Let @getusha decide.
Thanks

The main problem is the first proposal will cause the regression and it was edited after I posted my proposal. I don't say that adding `prevIsDeletedParentAction` to optimize is the key point to selecting the proposal.

Waiting for review from @getusha.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.4.2-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: 1. Log in to User A's account 2. Open User B's chat 3. Send a message 4. Open User A’s chat from User B’s account in a different browser 5. Hover over the message and click on “Reply in thread” 6. Send a message in the thread 7. Click on “Add reaction” on the thread message 8. Go back to User A's account 9. Delete the sent message ## Expected Result: The emoji picker should close on User B's side when User A deletes the message ## Actual Result: The emoji picker does not close on User B's side when User A deletes the message ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/78819774/6962f78b-cce9-4591-ab71-7713e8ee0a6e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
